result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Atlena Pinkston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Atlena Pinkston in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Atlena Pinkston.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Saint Pierre was just appointed to the case and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Atlena Pinkston in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Atlena Pinkston.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense does not have discovery or an offer.  Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 10:00 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CLD

Defendant Atlena Pinkston appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway appeared by video for Atlena Pinkston.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
